boardgame.name: Ätsch: reingefallen
boardgame.description:
Each player has to get four pawns from start to finish. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a "1" a pawn gets from the start to space 1 to get into the race. Before moving each player has to adjust the slide table according to the result of his roll. Pawns falling into the holes are eliminated from the game. If a pawn would move onto a hole it is put back on the starting space instead. The first player to get the most pawns to the finish wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Vampunks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

VAMPUNKS is a gothic cyberpunk tabletop roleplaying game in which you and your friends take on the role of devil-may-care vampire hunters facing off against ancient undead in a chaotic sci-fi future. With dark magic and deadly machines working against you, can the latest generation of monster slayers take back the night?


Create a team of battle-ready vampunks, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, to face off against the vampiric threat.
Use an easy to learn three D6 (or 666) system to take on all the challenges that the vampires have in store.
Cling onto your fragile life by EMBRACING VAMPIRISM when your vampunk faces Death's door. Gain dark powers at the risk of your very soul!
Survived the mission? Spend your hard earned cash on UPGRADES that will augment your vampunk into an ever more powerful cyborg badass.
Bring your Game Master into the fun with The Punk Wrangler role as they try (and fail) to keep their vampunks from tearing this city apart!
Take on four distinct missions and 19 different enemies, or use this augment friendly system to create your own unique adventures!


The base-game includes...


Rules for set up, character creation, and general gameplay.
Four different adventures to play through.
19 different enemies to use.
12 pieces of stylish art throughout its pages.
Tables for gaining vampiric powers and post-mission upgrades.
Printable character sheets for both the vampunks (players) and the Punk Wrangler (game master).
Cut off points for curious players and Punk Wranglers ready to learn more.
34 total pages of vampire slaying fun.


We may be in the future, but our blood sucking friends are timeless.

Good luck, VAMPUNKS, you'll need it.

boardgame.name: Vampunks Mission Pack: 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New missions, new enemies, and new art for all aspiring vampire slayers of the future to enjoy!


BAT OUT OF HELL has you and your vampunks on an extermination job gone wrong. Can you face the deadly vampire bats deep below the Earth? Can you uncover the secrets their nest hides? And most of all, can you escape with your humanity intact?



MALL'D TO DEATH will have you explore the decayed remains of a once prosperous shopping center now long since abandoned...or so we thought. Can you work with the gangs that call this place home and stop it from becoming a mall of the undead?



NIGHT OF THE VAMPDROID puts your vampunk skills to the test as you face off against the deadliest creation that science and vampirism have made yet! Can you uncover the mystery of the vampdroid and stop its rampage before it's too late?



MOONPIRES is an out-of-this-world adventure that will push your vampunks to the limit. A moon base riddled with vampires, a plot that could doom the entire world, and a dwindling supply of oxygen. Can the vampunks take back the moon?


The expansion includes...


Four new misisons to play through.
Seven new enemies to face.
Six new stylish illustrations.
16 total pages of vampire slaying fun.

boardgame.name: Freikorps und Spartacist: Wargame Rules German Civil War 1919-1923
boardgame.description:
At the end of the First World War, civil war erupted across Germany between Left Wing forces and reactionary forces of the Right - the Freikorps.
As thousands of heavily armed and disgruntled troops returned from the Front, vicious fighting flared in cities and towns across Germany between rival groups keen to shape the future of the nation.

These rules cover this conflict and weave in such diverse elements as propaganda, street fighting, air power, and leaflet drops, rail strikes and of course all the necessary rules for infantry, cavalry, artillery, and tank warfare.

The rules also describe the various forces involved from stormtroopers, to armed police, Volksmarine, and all of the other diverse participants involved.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stormfall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take the Fight to Them!

Following a distress call left by an old acquaintance, the team infiltrates an abandoned research base. A final showdown awaits them against a rogue faction of techno-zealots and their deranged ringleader..

Stormfall is a 4 hour adventure for 5th through 8th level characters using the Esper Genesis Roleplaying Game. It is also part of the Crucible Corps organized play campaign.

boardgame.name: Mantis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghosts and darkness represent those paid to assassinate individuals in the Chinese underworld. Mantis has built her reputation on the notion that quick and decisive kills are not always clean. Can the heroes stop her before she hits and fades back into the darkness?

boardgame.name: Lords of Vegas: Underworld – Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 3 promo cards given out with each copy of Lords of Vegas: Underworld backed on the Lords of Vegas 10th Anniversary Kickstarter.

The cards include:

The Big Score - When your casino pays, you may gain an additional $1M per tile of the casino, then discard this card.

Time Share - When building a casino tile, you may use the blank 10th tile of that color as your tile if it is available.

Binding Contract - The final wording of this card is not yet complete, but will have something to do with a promise of future actions. This card will reference the Lone Shark Games Apocrypha Adventure Card Game as that game had a card that referenced Lords of Vegas.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lords of Vegas: Underworld

boardgame.name: Dogo Dash
boardgame.description:
Dogo Dash
Dogo Dash is a quick-playing, super-colorful card game for 2 to 5 players. It’s a game of dogs and cats, bears and humans, where one is always trying to outdo the other. Who is going to come out on top? Will the Good Boys cause trouble for the Bears? Or will Cats woo over Cookie? Only a game of Dogo Dash will tell!

Components
1 rule sheet
60 cards
• 22 Cats
• 18 Dogs
• 12 Bears
• 4 Cookies
• 4 Good Boys

Setup
1. Shuffle the deck of cards face down.
2. Deal four cards to each player. This forms your hand. Keep your cards secret!
3. Place the deck face down in reach of all players. This is the draw deck.
4. Now you’re ready to play. It’s that easy!

Gameplay
Dogo Dash is played over multiple rounds. At the end of each round, players determine the winner of the round and score points. Then, everyone draws more cards. Once the draw deck is empty, one final round occurs and then the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

Round
Each round, players follow the same order of play.
1. All players secretly choose a card from their hand they want to play.
2. Place it face down in front of you and don’t show it to anyone.
3. When everyone has chosen a card, someone yells out DO-GO DAAAAASH!
4. All players reveal their cards simultaneously.
5. Now it’s time to see who won!

Round Winner
To determine the winner, check the played cards to see who played the strongest one:

Dog is stronger than Cat
Bear is stronger than Dog and Cat
Cookie is stronger than Dog and Bear
Cat is stronger than Cookie

Whoever played the strongest card takes all of the played cards and keeps them in a score pile in front of them. Each card counts as a point at the end of the game.

If there is a tie between two or more players for the strongest card, the tied players play another round between themselves but do not draw any additional cards. They continue playing until someone wins or they have played all of their cards. If no one wins, then the players split the points as evenly as possible, discarding the extra card if it’s an odd amount.

Watch out! If there is a Good Boy on the table, things get tricky.
Good Boys force a tie, no matter what cards are on the table. Play another round as detailed above.

Once the winner has been determined, all players draw cards until they have four cards in hand.

Last Round
The Last Round happens when there are no more cards to draw from the draw deck. Players now play one more round only using the cards they have left in hand.

1. All players secretly choose a card and place it face down in front of you.
2. All players take all of their unplayed cards in their hands and put them face down in the middle of the table. This makes the Super Pot!
3. Someone yells out DO-GO DAAAAASH! and all players reveal their cards simultaneously.
4. The winner takes all of the cards in the Super Pot!
o If there is a tie, the tied players split the Super Pot as evenly as possible.

Scoring
Once the Last Round has been played, count the cards you have collected.
Whoever has collected the most cards wins.
If there is a tie, then all tied players win!

Keep Your Eyes Open
If you pay attention to what cards have been played, then you can stay ahead of everyone else. Try and remember the number of different cards there are and use it in your favor to choose the right card at the
right time.

For instance: if you paid attention to how many Cookies were played, you can win the Super Pot with a cat, which is the character beaten by most cards, but wins against Cookie.
Combos

The Catnip Variant
When you get comfortable with the basics, here’s an extra move to add to the game.
If you have four cats in your hand, you can choose to play a Catnip:
1. Instead of playing one card, you put down all four cards and say ‘catnip.’
2. You then put all four of your played cards onto your own score pile. You didn’t win the round, but you keep the points for yourself.
3. 3. Everyone else continues the round as normal.

The Dogo Dash!
If you played a Dog and didn’t win the round, but you have another Dog in your hand, then you can make a Dogo Dash! Before the winner takes the cards, reveal your second Dog card. You now get to keep the Dog you just played and the Dog you just rescued from the winner. Put both cards in your score pile.

Credits
Author & Game Designer: Talita Rhein
Illustrator & Co-Designer: Margherita Barrera
Co-Designer: Johanna Janiszewski
Production Support & QA: Philipp Keydel
Rules Editing: Travis D. Hill

boardgame.name: バック・トゥ・ジ・アース (Back to the Earth)
boardgame.description:
In バック・トゥ・ジ・アース (Back to the Earth), players are researchers developing and launching exploration satellites to investigate nearby planets, as Earth has been threatened by a sudden turbulence in the gravitational field of the universe.

The game takes place on a "board" of 4 pieces of paper that are set into a plastic bag and show the near-by planets and their orbits. The provided "planets" are clear plastic hemispheres that the players fill with colored clay during setup to establish the look of their galaxy.

Each of the planets has a magnetic strip along the base and a player's goal each turn is to "launch" a satellite (steel ball) from a rocket (wooden chute) that they position as they like above the Earth piece. Moreover, their goal is to have the ball reach a target planet, swing around the planet's orbit using a "gravitational slingshot" type maneuver, and return to the earth with data about the planet. If successful, a player plants one of their flags in the planet and earns victory points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Empires, Republics, Theocracies - Light and Dark - in the end, its just Politics

Whether you're on the side of the government or in on the rebellion, Whether you're in a nebula far far away, or battle close to home; It matters not - It all boils down to individual heroes and rogues

90+ Tokens in all three view points: Top Down, Front Facing and Face Plates. This set includes multiple races in different styles of uniform and job classification.

Take a look, and as always, Play your world, your way

boardgame.name: Republic Alliance Set Two: Droids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Empires, Republics, Theocracies - Light and Dark - in the end, its just Politics

Whether you're on the side of the government or in on the rebellion, Whether you're in a nebula far far away, or battle close to home; It matters not - It all boils down to individual heroes and rogues

90+ Tokens in all three view points: Top Down, Front Facing and Face Plates. This set includes multiple races in different styles of uniform and job classification.

Take a look, and as always, Play your world, your way

boardgame.name: Town and Country Science Fiction Style
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you think that Town and Country City sets are only for Fantasy settings? Think again.

Here is a setting for Science Fiction or futuristic settings. I have provided 55+ digitally rendered tokens for all your City mapping needs. (20 Top down and the rest side and front views for hand outs)

Design your cities and play your game, your way

boardgame.name: Creature Encounter Death from Above
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As a GM, need a change of tactics? Or Perhaps you need a special NPC or BBEG that has a not-so-secret weapon at the ready?

3-D fighting, right, left, back, front, above, and below.... Get ready for Airborne forces at your disposal.

70 digitally rendered tokens with both front facing and top down views.

boardgame.name: Rest, Relaxation & Intoxication Tavern Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It doesn't really matter where your bar is, What the name, or even how many stars the local review gives it. All that matters are the people - The Patrons.

This set is made up of tokens (mostly human: the other fantasy races will be in another set) set in a similar style to the middle ages, playable in most any fantasy setting. Male, Female, different sizes, poses and perspectives - so you can play this game your way.

boardgame.name: The Family: Background Interrogation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Loyalty is everything!
You go through life hoping never to hear the dreaded words,
"I am so disappointed in you... You disrespected me.. You disrespected my family, ..."

Invariably it means a trip to the backroom, and once there - that's it, Poof you're gone.

This set has everything you need to interrogate, intimidate and coerce those that cross you.

boardgame.name: Creature Encounter D&D Classic Monsters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepare your players — the dungeon is now populated with Classic D&D monsters. From manticores to displacer beasts, Stop in, take a look and for the minuscule price of an answer to a riddle, you can take them home.

(Pricing guidelines vary from individual to individual - Not all riddles apply, see your local seller for rules and guidelines)
Our Classic Encounter Set comes complete with 90 digitally rendered tokens in both top down and Front facing viewpoints.

And as always Play your world, in your way.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Town Insignias
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You spent so much time making these maps, and setting up every shop - Now, with this set you have the tools to make it easier for your players to find their way through the city at a glance.

There are 70+, high resolution, digitally rendered tokens to be used as Insignias for your maps.

boardgame.name: Your Neighborhood Mapping Insignias
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You spent so much time making these maps, and setting up every shop - Now, with this set you have the tools to make it easier for your players to find their way through the city at a glance.

There are 74, high resolution, digitally rendered tokens to be used as Insignias for your maps.

boardgame.name: Printable for Table Top Play (Festivals, Fairs and Fun)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A circus set, sized to print out for table top games. This set includes 70+ items includes rides, carnival folk, animals and props all, in the top down view.

These Files are for Personal use Only, and are not for use for anything commercial without an extended license.

I hope you enjoy the high quality digitally rendered set

boardgame.name: Printable for Table Top Play (Webb's Sedans I & II Top Down View)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a remake of my original "Webbs Sedans" and "Webbs Sedans II"

that are in the original size format. 60+ tokens of various automobiles in top down view.

Highly detailed, these pictures can be used to make printed paper tokens for use in Table Top Rpgs.

These Files are for Personal use Only, and are not for use for anything commercial without an extended license.

boardgame.name: Class Modifier Module (CMM) for 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
Description from the designer:

A narrative-driven character creation tool, for modifiers by class rather than race.

The Module has all of the base classes in 5th edition included! Artificer and the other classes outside of the base book may be done in the future. The donations are split between the artist (@Tallinier) and I (the designer), and helps get more art sooner than later! It comes in PDF form.

This module is made with the preference that, rather than getting statistic changes from races, it comes from classes instead in 5th Edition. This is to make the class choice both narrative and statistical, rather than emphasize that bonus through race, so that a human ranger can be just as good as an elven ranger. This does NOT exist to change emphasis that certain cultures have a preference over classes, but instead to diversify it a bit. Currently this only takes into note the base classes, but in the future I may update to include Artificer, Psion, and Bloodhunter (and potentially UA classes).

boardgame.name: Victims, Dead and Dying Set 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether the town was visited by the black plague, raided by orcs, or there's a serial killer in town; victims have a tendency to show up.

Now you have the means to show them off.. From assault to vicious battles, we have the tokens for you.

Create your dungeons, your way

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Polikarpov I-16 Squadron
boardgame.description:
In-game, you'll find these little wasps to be incredibly useful - field a swarm of low-cost, agile fighters with a low minimum move which will allow you to out turn faster-moving aircraft and set up the perfect attack!

A small squadron of these Polikarpov I-16 could support a group Yak-1s or Mig-3s, acting as a second line to swoop down on anything that should slip through after the first engagement.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Festivals, Fairs and Fun Set Two: Animals, Clowns & Acrobats
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lions, Tigers, and Bearded Ladies oh my, and of course lets not forget the circus folk.

With this new token set, you have the perfect staff to aid you in running away to the circus.

Acrobats, Clowns, Animal tamers and no story would be complete without a ringmaster or two.

No matter what your story is, play your world.. Your way

80+ digitally rendered tokens, featuring both Top Down and Front Facing Views.

boardgame.name: Festivals, Fairs and Fun Set One: Rides, Equipment & the Big Top
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Step Right Up, Step right up. Come see the show at the Big top, Play on the Water Slide, or just hang out at the park. But most importantly Pick up these tokens, so we can transport you to carnivals, parks and faires.

Please note: Actual human and animal population in set two.
80+ digitally rendered tokens representing the physical equipment and fanfare of the circus, park, and faire, featuring both Top Down and Front Facing Views.

All your Carnival needs: Enjoy the rides and attractions as you play your world your way

boardgame.name: Town and Country Set Three
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each Town Set is different, with its own quirks, idiosyncrasies and charm.

This particular set is built with an Asian flair, incorporating images like pagodas, shrines and statues to inflame and entice your imagination.

80+ Tokens, beautifully rendered with both Front Facing and Top Down views, this set is definitely worth a look.

boardgame.name: Small Town Set 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each Town is different, with its own quirks, idiosyncrasies and charm. This small town set comes with street vendors, park benches and a quirky houses, ideal to add a unique flavor and design to your games.

Check out what small towns have to offer.

Play your world, your way.

80+ Digitally Rendered Tokens with both Front Facing and Top views

boardgame.name: Beginning Dungeon Torture Chamber Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Has your party been captured by the orcish hordes, or simply jailed for slaying that annoying villager? Need to strike some fear into their hearts? Look no further, than the Beginning Dungeon: Torture Chamber. With all the tools a good dungeon keeper needs to make PC's tell their whole plan like a lich's monologue. And remember to play your world... Your way

boardgame.name: Sky Islands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have the rules of gravity changed suddenly? Is the earth filled with pockets of helium? Have wizards brought their towers to the skies? Whatever the case may be, these gorgeous floating islands will fill your needs. Even the Land takes to the skies sometimes...

Play your World, your way!

80+ digitally rendered Tokens, Maptiles and Monsters for your gaming needs, in both Front facing and top down views.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Nakajima B5N 'Kate' Squadron
boardgame.description:
The B5N 'Kate' although didn't compare up to other aircraft at the start of its involvement in the war, still served throughout the entirety of it.

It had a 3-man crew, pilot, navigator/bombardier/observer, and radio operator/gunner.

Ensure the Pacific Ocean is under your control with the Nakajima B5N ‘Kate’, Japan’s main torpedo bomber!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Imperial Japanese Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Beginning Dungeon Set Hellscape Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For all you GMs, that have told your players (or at least thought about telling them) to go to Hell, Now is your chance to send them there yourself.

When Hell rises to greet your party, be prepared with the Hell-scape set. With Demons and Devils of all shapes and sizes.

Watch them ride into battle with unholy steeds and hell-hounds at their flanks.

And remember to play your world... Your way

80+ digitally rendered Tokens, Maptiles, and Monsters for your gaming needs, in both Front facing and top down views.

boardgame.name: Beginning Dungeon Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you a New GM? Or maybe you're just new to Virtual Table Top playing? Perhaps you just feel like you're missing some of the basics.

In any case this is the set for you! Map Tiles, Walls, Doors, Traps, Treasure and Monsters. What more could you ask for other than a group of friends to play with!!! Become the Dungeon Master you were Destined to be and Play Your way!

boardgame.name: Alchemy Props Set Number 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Attention All Mad Scientists, Mages, Alchemists and Adventurers!
Are you looking for your next set of components? Or tired of spending 5 gp on potions? Then come on by to the new magic shop, where we have all your ingredients.

Play.. Your way.

90+ digitally rendered tokens with both views top down and front facing.

boardgame.name: People in Your Town (Set 1)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Modern day towns, with people from all ages, races, and walks of life.

50 faceplates that include uniforms and everyday outfits.

boardgame.name: People in Your Town (Set 2)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Modern day towns, with people from all ages, races, and walks of life.

50 faceplates that include uniforms and everyday outfits.

boardgame.name: The Shipyard: Mechs, Ships and Copters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mechs, ships and hover cars, they aren't just equipment. They are an extension of yourself - Of your values - Of your pride.

Here at the Shipyard we have all makes and models for you to browse through, test drive and quite possibly go home in.


Safety of all things not guaranteed. We are not liable for anything stolen, broken or otherwise exploded

boardgame.name: IceBear Rifts: Personnel Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DeathSquad, PSICore, Mutants and more - This Sci Fi based Miltiary Personnel pack has everything you need to fill out your base.

90+ digitally rendered tokens with all views top down, Faceplates, and front facing.

boardgame.name: Other World Flora 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For all you Science fiction fans and homebrew gamers.
Just think, with all the worlds that are available for exploration - GMS everywhere are in need of alien vegetation.

This set has just the thing, Map-Tiles for the game map and Faceplates for identification, physical description and pharmaceutical effects.

boardgame.name: Other World Flora: Set Two
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For all you Science fiction fans and homebrew gamers.
Just think, with all the worlds that are available for exploration - GMS everywhere are in need of alien vegetation.

This set has just the thing, Map-Tiles for the game map and Faceplates for identification, physical description and pharmaceutical effects.

boardgame.name: Other World Flora: Set One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For all you Science fiction fans and homebrew gamers.
Just think, with all the worlds that are available for exploration - GMS everywhere are in need of alien vegetation.

This set has just the thing, Map-Tiles for the game map and Faceplates for identification, physical description and pharmaceutical effects.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: American Ace Pilot – Joseph J Foss
boardgame.description:
Joe Foss became the first American ‘Ace of Aces” in WWII during three months of frenzied air combat during the Battle of Guadalcanal, as he lead a flight of eight Marine Corps Grumman F4F Wildcats known as “Foss’s Flying Circus”.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Lycanthropy Encounter Set One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From Shapeshifters and Were-Creatures to Animorphs, this set covers all your Full Moon Needs!

It is 50+ digital rendered tokens in all three views.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – 'Pappy' Boyington
boardgame.description:
Major Gregory “Pappy” Boyington (Medal of Honor, Navy Cross) learnt his deadly trade during a year’s tour in China as a member of the 1st American Volunteer Group (The Flying Tigers).
Upon returning to the US, In 1943, he was charged to take a group of twenty-seven young men and form the new Marine Attack Squadron 214.

VMA214 (Black Sheep) would earn its reputation and the Presidential Unit Citation for extraordinary heroism in action under Pappy's command; fighting for 84 days achieving a record 203 Japanese planes destroyed or damaged, produced nine fighter aces with 97 confirmed air-to-air kills (22 by Boyington), several troop transports and supply ships sunk, destroyed many installations, in addition to numerous other victories.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Colony Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Space Colonies is a SCI-FI set for offworld outposts containing 80+ tokens of buildings, map-tiles, equipment and colonist faceplates(with both Topdown and 3d views).

boardgame.name: Back Alley Treasures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark dreary nights, back alleyways or post apocalyptic litter...
This 50+ token pack will serve in any modern setting; Including trash, drug paraphernalia, and discarded weapons no matter what your genre is, you can find a place for the tokens in this pack.

Just remember, One man's trash is another man's treasure .. or evidence

boardgame.name: Treasure Tokens Set One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A treasure set complete with 50+ pieces of armor, weaponry and art. The very thing for any GM to create homebrew artifacts and/or line the pockets of the players in the game.

boardgame.name: Treasure Tokens Set Two
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A treasure set complete with 50+ pieces of armor, weaponry and art. The very thing for any GM to create homebrew artifacts and/or line the pockets of the players in the game.

boardgame.name: Creature Encounter Set Humanoids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepare your players! The dungeon is now populated. A unit for every type of gameplay- from driders and minotaurs to... fungus?

Gather all of these great tokens today. Create your world your way!

I have 90+ tokens in this set in all the various views: Top down, front facing and faceplate.

boardgame.name: Earth - Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome one and all to DMS Creation's rendition of Dragon tokens.

50+ tokens for your fantasy game-play. This package comes with 3 different viewpoints; Top down, 3-dimentional & faceplates.

7 different Dragon colorations: Bone, Black, Brown, Gold, Red, Green & Silver & bonus material consisting of saddled/armored dragons in each of the six "living" colors.

boardgame.name: What "Floats Your Boat" Pack Old World and New
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cure for anything is salt water: Sweat, Tears or the Sea - Karen Blixen

The Sea: It calls to the very heart of us.

50+ tokens to expand the adventure through dangerous waters, Exploring the ocean with this pack of longboats, barges and sampans.

The pack shows two veiwpoints: 3d and topdown. There is also a water map tile, a lighthouse and a few sea monsters to entice/scare your players.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Ace Pilot – Alexandr Pokryshkin
boardgame.description:
Pokryshkin was a three-time recipient of the Hero of the Soviet Union decoration during wartime - for his exceptional air combat record of 53 solo kills and 6 shared ones (though these tallies are disputed nowadays).

He was airborne on the first day of Operation Barbarossa, shooting down a Bf109 after being jumped on a recon mission, and would continue flying for the duration of the war, inventing new air combat tactics and stoking the USSR's propaganda mill.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Webb's Sedans II - Racing & Derby Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Enjoy Racing? Demolition Derby? Or just need some tokens for a car graveyard?

50+ digitally rendered tokens with various views (top, front and side).

boardgame.name: Webb's Sedans
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beautifully rendered replicas of old world cars in all three viewpoints for your gaming needs.

The Rich, The Beautiful, The Powerful - they all need cars to reflect their status.

So this may very well be the set for you.

boardgame.name: Mardol's Minions Set 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

People are you lacking diversity and representation in the marketplace?

Well step right up and view the answer to your problems...

80+ tokens in all three formats set up to represent the People of Fantasy Gaming

boardgame.name: Cartography: Set 2 The Nightmare Lands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Enchanted forest - But not your typical Disney version; all sweetness and light.

No, this is the Nightmare lands: Spirit-infused rocks and trees at every turn, and phantoms lighting the way.

boardgame.name: Giant-Kin Encounter Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever needed a Big Bad and Ugly for your scene or game?

Well let me tell you, while I can't confirm bad, They are BIG and UGLY.

I have 50+ tokens in this set in all the various views: Top down, front facing and faceplate that Include all types of Ogres and a couple of storm giants.

boardgame.name: Encounter Set Goblin Town Central
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever needed a Big Bad and Ugly for your scene or game? Well let me tell you, while I can't confirm Big, they are Bad and UGLY.

I have 50+ tokens in this set in all the various views: Top down, front facing and faceplate that include all types of Goblins and their village.

boardgame.name: There's Always Time for Steampunk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Set is filled with a wide variety of people and styles, set in the Steampunk fashion.

There are 50 + digitally rendered face-plates for your gaming needs.

boardgame.name: Lasgidi Rats
boardgame.description:
A great famine has descended upon the rat kingdom. Many rats are starving and many more have passed to the great beyond. But all hope is not lost. There is a prophecy of a guardian that will lead the survivals to a great city filled with food – the LASGIDI city.

The surviving rats must ﬁnd their way to homes of Lasgidians (humans of Lasgidi). As the Guardian, you must lead the last survivors through underground tunnels to the holes in the houses across the city. This is your mission, lead the ﬁrst batch of the rats safely to the yam store and gather your path points. Beware of the dangers you may encounter.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Mikotan Gurevich MiG-3 Squadron
boardgame.description:
While the MiG-3 has the Sluggish trait, it is a serviceable frontline fighter with decent mobility conferred by the Great Dive trait, with an agility and firepower score equal to that of the early war Bf109's it's most likely to come into contact with.

A squadron of these could easily support Yak-1s or I-16s without too much trouble.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Dinosaur 1944
boardgame.description:
CINCPAC has gotten reports of activity on Kyoryu Jima, so the US military has landed a reconnaissance force. But the Japanese aren’t here at all! It is something much worse ... something that threatens all humanity. Dinosaurs! Mad scientists are using Kyoryu Jima as a base for their time machine, bringing prehistoric monsters into the present day. Not content with unleashing this plague, they’ve gone even farther – they are training and enhancing the dinosaurs. It’s bad enough to fight giant reptiles – fighting drug-crazed giant reptiles is absolutely the worst.

Dinosaur: 1944 is a cooperative strategy game about army men vs. prehistoric monsters. In it, you and up to 3 other players control brave soldiers in a World War II setting, struggling to save the entire world from the threat of a Mesozoic rebirth. It is in part a battle game, as you maneuver around the map and fight the enemy. It is in part tower defense, as you place ambushes to help take out or slow down the incoming fiends. Each hero has unique strengths and weaknesses – your victory depends both in mastering your own hero and cooperating with your friends. As the game progresses, you face more numerous foes, and dinosaur bosses enter the field. Eventually, you face the final boss – defeating her wins the game. Beware: if the dinosaurs devastate your base camp, you’ll be stranded on Kyuryushima, prey to the horrors therein.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Orcs Must Die! The Board Game: Order Edition

listing.notes: Preorder of the base game pledge including the relating stretch goals. Shipping to be paid extra.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Ace Pilot – Vladimir Pokrovsky
boardgame.description:
Vladimir Pokrovsky began flying I-16s in the Northern Fleet's 72nd Mixed Aviation Squadron, flying over the Murmansk Front during the early period of the war.

Like many pilots, he switched aircraft many times, from Hurricanes to Kittyhawks, Airacobras and Yak-1bs.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Soviet Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld Mega Pack
boardgame.description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe! Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight! Mega Packs let you jumpstart your collection with six characters: four starting Heroes (including an exclusive Negative Zone Spider-Man variant) and two more trapped in Thanostones! Choose your favorite hero, and use their unique special abilities. Roll to attack and win three battles to achieve victory!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Marvel Battleworld: Series 1 Thanos Ship Showdown
Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight Talon Fighter
Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight The Collector's Tower

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Path of Initiation
boardgame.description:
The Path of Initiation is a role-playing board game of Spiritual Evolution upon the Greath Wheel of Life & Death!

Players begin as a young Ego/Personality and move their Avatars around the gameboard and their Soul-Stones up the Kabbalistic 'Tree of Life.'

Players are tasked with resolving Life Lessons using the Special Powers of their 'class' while demonstrating knowledge of the 7 Hermetic Principles.

Other players role-play the Higher Self and the Lords of Karma and together reward the player with the Karma, Polarity & Experience Points to gain Initiation and win the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Philip Kirkwood
boardgame.description:
Lieutenant, Junior Grade Philip Leroy Kirkwood was awarded the Navy Cross for extraordinary heroism in operations against the enemy.

Flying the F4U Corsair with the Grim Reapers (VF-10) from the USS Intrepid (CV-11) Kirkwood took part in strikes against the Ryukyu Islands, Kyūshū, Okinawa and Wake Island, downing 8 enemy aircraft bringing his tally to 12.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – United States Army Air Forces
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Superpuzzle
boardgame.description:
Superpuzzle contains two sets of pieces in different colors. Each set consists of 24 pieces: 12 rectangles and 12 rectangles with one corner cut off.

The game also contains a book of 60 puzzles, each of which is a shape that can be made with one set of pieces. If played by two players each can take one set of pieces and try to be the first to complete the puzzle.

boardgame.name: Times Table Trio
boardgame.description:
Times Table Trio contains two decks of 60 cards each; each deck contains the 58 unique numbers appearing in the multiplication tables up to 12, plus two jokers. The rules recommend using one deck with two or three players and two with more, but experienced players may always use two decks.

Each player is dealt 9 or 12 cards (12 being more challenging) and attempts to make sets of three cards (trios) which are consecutive multiples of the same number, e.g. 2-4-6 or 55-66-77. This is done via standard Rummy-style play - a player draws the top card of the deck or discard pile and then discards a card. If a joker is used in a trio a player holding the card it is representing may also swap that for the joker.

Completed trios are placed face-up on the table. Players may lay off cards on any trio to form longer sequences, and may also form new trios in different directions.

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: German Ace Pilot – Hans Dortenmann
boardgame.description:
Hans Dortenmann was a Luftwaffe ace who, after his completion of aerial training, starting serving on the Eastern Front where he scored his first victory.

Shortly after, he was transferred to the Western Front where he claimed many more victories against the Allied forces. He continued to serve until the end of the war.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Focke Wulf Fw 190D 'Dora' Squadron
boardgame.description:
The Fw 190 Dora was a single-seat, single-engined fighter aircraft. Alongside the Messerschmitt Bf 109, it became the backbone of the Luftwaffe.

It fulfilled a variety of roles including; day fighter, fighter-bomber, ground-attack aircraft and, to an extent, night fighter.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Blood Red Skies: Supermarine Spitfire Mk IX squadron
boardgame.description:
Created out of the need to update the Spitfire VB which was being hilariously outperformed by the Focke-Wulf Fw 190.

The new Spitfire Mk IX was leaps and bounds above its predecessors in terms of aviation and combat abilities.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Blood Red Skies – Royal Air Force
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain

boardgame.name: Elite Dangerous: Horizons
boardgame.description:
Elite Dangerous: Horizons brings Planetary Landings to the Elite Dangerous galaxy, together with weapon crafting, ship-launched fighters, multicrew co-op and much more. Put wheels on the ground and explore the galaxy up-close. This second season of Elite Dangerous is available to buy now for PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.

PLANETARY LANDINGS
Travel seamlessly from space to any point on the surface of accurately simulated planets and moons throughout Elite Dangerous' full-scale Milky Way galaxy, and drive new SRV ground vehicles. Each 1:1 scale world offers incredible vistas and countless gameplay opportunities.

THARGOIDS HAVE RETURNED
Elite Dangerous: Horizons 2.4 – The Return introduces new technology and tactical options to combat the rising alien threat. Support the Aegis organization in massive-scale community goals to unlock powerful anti-Thargoid weapons and equipment, and take the fight back to the Thargoids.

HOLO-ME
Holo-Me is Elite Dangerous: Horizons' Commander creator and editor, giving players the power to create a unique face and physical appearance for their in-game avatar. The highly customizable Holo-Me system offers thousands of options, making every Commander recognizable with just a glance.

MULTICREW
Multicrew co-op gives groups of players the opportunity to fly aboard the same ship, assuming one of three specialized roles. Multicrewed ships gain precision firepower and additional control, giving Commanders a vital edge in combat as they share in the galaxy’s rewards... and its punishments.

PASSENGER TRANSPORT
A whole new career path emerges as the Pilot’s Federation allows a new era of passenger transport. Take on missions transporting politicians, VIPs and prisoners across the galaxy, and smuggle covert operatives to their destinations in the new Beluga passenger vessel.

SHIP-LAUNCHED FIGHTERS
Take what comes and strike back with double. Choose from three unique ship-launched fighters to deploy from your larger ships’ docking bay. Fly into battle with twice the firepower and your own NPC crew, and bring a second gun to every fight. Combat will never be the same again.

AN EVOLVING GALAXY
Discover a galaxy of new challenges and new wonders, featuring neutron stars, capital ship dockyards, civilian installations and upgraded starport interiors. Explore planet surfaces and uncover new geology, ancient mysteries and unknown threats.

SHIP CUSTOMIZATION
Unlock a new level of customization for your ship and modules. Hidden on planet surfaces across the populated galaxy, each Engineer has a unique personality and history – and they just might choose to help you... for the right price.

LOOTING AND CRAFTING
Discover game-changing loot and craft a ship unlike any other. Smuggle materials to the outposts of the elusive Engineers and earn their respect to unlock powerful module upgrades.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Elite Dangerous: Odyssey
boardgame.description:
Disembark, Commander, and leave your mark on the galaxy in Elite Dangerous: Odyssey. Explore distant worlds on foot and expand the frontier of known space. Be the first to step out onto countless unique planets as you discover land untouched since time began. Elite Dangerous: Odyssey invites you to become a true pioneer.

ONE GIANT LEAP
See the galaxy like never before. Touch down on breathtaking planets powered by stunning new tech, soak in suns rising over unforgettable vistas, discover outposts and settlements, and explore with unrestricted freedom.

FORGE YOUR OWN PATH
Take on a wide variety of contracts and play your way, from diplomacy and commerce to lethal stealth and all-out combat. Diverse settings, objectives, and NPCs offer endless mission variety and a near infinite amount of content to enjoy.

ASSEMBLE YOUR CREW
Social hubs spread throughout the galaxy give Commanders the ideal place to plan their next move. Form alliances, procure services, and even find expert support in highly coveted Engineers. These public outposts also help you acquire and upgrade weapons and gear to perfect your playing style.

THE SPHERE OF COMBAT
Experience intense first-person combat, kit out your character with an array of weapons and gear, and coordinate with teammates to master a multi-layered, deep, tactical environment where Commanders, SRVs and Starships converge.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The 7th Continent: Das Lied des Kristalls
The 7th Continent: Le Chant du Cristal
The 7th Continent: The Crystal's Song
boardgame.description:
The 7th Continent: Das Lied des Kristalls features a short curse to serve as an introduction to the game as well as several alternative game modes that will make your adventure easier — or more difficult!

• The Crystal's Song: This curse lasts 1-2 hours and offers high replayability to make it easier to get into the game or to play a (relatively) fast round! This curse uses the new "crystal Discovery cards" instead of the normal discovery cards to offer fresh challenges. You discover these new cards and move forward until no crystal discovery cards are available, then the game ends. Now it's time to see whether you've broken the curse or not...

• Prodigy mode: In this game mode, your explorers are incredibly talented, so you start with five additional action cards. This not only increases your stack, but allows you to take further actions. The powerful cards show multiple achievements, key words, and skills to strengthen your powers, to make actions easier, to activate character skills, and to protect you!

• Immortal Mode: Not everyone can survive, and some get queasy when they see the rapidly shrinking stack of action cards. If you are one of them, this mode is for you!

How does it work? Very simple: Put the medallion in your backpack at the start of the adventure, and if you fail due to an unexpected turn of fate, you only have to wait for the magic. You're already in the middle of an adventure again, but maybe not quite as you imagined it... The medallion should not be misused as eternal life has a high price. How high? Well, you have to find out for yourself. All you have to do is die!

• "There is a traitor among us!" Mode: Before the start of the game, randomly draw one of the seven fate cards and look at them in secret. Four of them are "Don't trust anyone!" cards and have no effect for the time being. The other three, however, are "The Continent Demands a Victim!" cards that give you only two options: murder an explorer at the best possible time, or die...in a cruel way!

And as if that weren't enough, the impact of each fate card is different, so you never know what to expect when you meet your friends — or your victims.

Note: do not purchase this expansion if you already have the What Goes Up, Must Come Down Collector white expansion box.

boardgame.name: Above the Horizon
boardgame.description:
Flying over the fabled mountain range the Roof of the World, your plane suddenly went down. Luckily, you were on your way to have an expedition in the mountains and your supplies were not ruined in the crash. Unfortunately, you have no idea where you are, or how far it is to civilization. Your expedition has started earlier than expected!

At the start of the game you draw between two to four goal cards to try to complete as you journey through the mountains. You also start with two items, either the rope or telescope, or the compass or map. Place a mountain token at the 10 spot of the fatigue tracker.

Now you are ready to explore the mountains!

At the start, draw a Mountain card from the bottom of the Mountain deck. This is the starting mountain, where you crashed. You do not have an Encounter on this card, so ignore the dice shown at the bottom of it. Then draw a Mountain card from the top of the Mountain deck and place it to the left or right of the starting card.

Each time you move to mountain, roll two dice. You are trying to either get your dice to match, or equal the dice on the bottom of the card. Then flip the card over and read the Encounter linked to the number of successes you rolled.

The game continues until you win by reaching all your goals, or you lose as your fatigue reaches 0.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Card Buluch
boardgame.description:
Card Buluch is played with a standard 52-card deck and a score card with ten boxes for each player.

On their turn a player turns over cards from the deck until they decide to stop or bust by revealing an ace or a two. If they don't bust they then select one of the boxes they have not used yet and score their revealed cards according to it. E.g. in box 1 they score if they have more red than black cards, in box 9 they score if they have a sequence of five cards, etc. If they cannot score or if they bust they must place an X in a box.

The game ends after both players have had ten turns.

boardgame.name: Bluff
boardgame.description:
Bluff uses a standard 52-deck plus a joker. It is played in a sequence of hands, each using a single suit plus the joker.

In each hand the 14 cards are dealt evenly to the two players and the dealer begins by playing a card face-down and stating what it is, but they may lie about it. The other player plays a card and the two are compared; the high card wins the trick. The joker is the highest card but is beaten by the ace (which is otherwise low). The winner leads to the next trick.

In the second through fourth hands the winner of the previous hand deals and then may exchange hands with the other player before leading to the first trick.

Play continues either until the end of the fourth hand, in which case the winner of that hand wins the game, or until a player reaches 100 points. In the latter case players score from one to four points per excess trick, depending on the hand. The whole cycle restarts with the fifth hand.

boardgame.name: コタツのなかからでたくない (I don't wanna leave kotatsu)
boardgame.description:
In コタツのなかからでたくない (I don’t wanna leave kotatsu), players want to both stay warm in the kotatsu, but also eat many satsuma oranges. However, there are chores to be done, and you may be able to earn oranges by doing them.

After constructing the game's kotatsu, the players slip their player piece partially inside. A player privately looks at the top tile from a deck of 16 chores, and places a number of oranges from a supply on the kotatsu; this number may be more or less than the value of the tile.

All players then discuss if they will leave the kotatsu to perform the chore. Once discussion is complete, the players simultaneously remove their player piece or leave it, and afterwards the tile is revealed. If the number of oranges placed on the kotatsu is less than that shown on the tile, the player(s) who performed the chore split the pot as evenly as possible. However, if the number of oranges placed on the kotatsu is greater than the value of the tile, the player(s) who performed the chore only split the oranges up to the value of the tile.

In either case, any remaining oranges are split as evenly as possible among the players who stayed in the kotatsu!

The tile is set aside face up; the lead player moves clockwise; and play continues. The game ends when the supply of oranges is exhausted, and the player with the most wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Shime-Shime Games (シメシメゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Angry Moms
boardgame.description:
Grab your family, friends and get ready for a shoe-throwing good time! Inspired by popular memes like #growingupblack, #growinguplatino, #growingupasian, and of course grandmothers and mothers of every culture, we bring you Angry Moms. It's a crazy fun game that involves some strategy, a little luck and an uncanny ability to dodge getting hit with house shoes, beach sandals, and chanclas.

How to play: Put the slippers on the table and deal 7 cards to each player. Set the deck on the table face-down to be the draw pile, and turn over the top card to start the discard pile. Take turns putting matching chore cards down on the discard pile. You can match on chore or color. Special action cards match every color. When an Angry Mom card is played, anyone can grab a slipper and throw it at someone else; the person hit has to pick up 5 cards from the draw pile. The first person with no cards left in their hand is the winner; or you can play until only one person is left.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DSA5 Mythos: Sandy Petersens Cthulhu Mythos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

DSA Myth contains dozens of eerie creatures of the Cthulhu Myth, myth books and artifacts, cults and their effects, spells and rituals of the myth, game aids for leading a Cthulhu adventure, and much more useful information about the connection between DSA and the myth of Lovecraft. The book contains more than 400 pages and full color illustrations of the horrific horrors beyond the 7th sphere.


Klappentext

DSA-Mythos enthält Dutzende schauriger Kreaturen des Cthulhu-Mythos, Mythos-Bücher und Artefakte, Kulte und deren Auswirkungen, Zaubersprüche und Rituale des Mythos, Spielhilfen zum Leiten eines Cthulhu-Abenteuers und viele weitere nützliche Informationen über die Verbindung zwischen DSA und dem Mythos von Lovecraft. Das Buch umfasst mehr als 400 Seiten und bebildert in Vollfarbe die grauenhaften Schrecken jenseits der 7. Sphäre.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Hedonites of Slaanesh
boardgame.description:
Of all the evil forces in the realms, the Hedonites of Slaanesh take the most pleasure in the carnage they wreak…

Slaanesh may be imprisoned – but, with this battletome, his powers are yours to master. This 96-page hardback battletome is your complete guide to the armies of the Dark Prince. You'll discover dark lore that sheds light on Slaanesh – the Chaos God of excess and pleasure – and his dreaded hosts. From the relentless seekers to usurping pretenders, this book brings some of the most sinister corners of the Mortal Realms to life in fantastic detail, with stunning art, new lore and tantalising hints of what the future holds for the Dark Prince. Meanwhile, a number of warscroll battalions, three sets of allegiance abilities, magical spells, command traits, artefacts and more allow you to build deadly Slaanesh armies made up of daemons and mortals alike. What’s more, the book contains painting tips and different colour schemes to inspire your collection, as well as bespoke missions and Path to Glory rules that are perfect for organising your first battles with Slaanesh’s hosts.

This book contains:


Allegiance abilities for Hedonites of Slaanesh, including a table of Battle Traits, a system for summoning Slaanesh Daemons, plus battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power for the following Hosts: Invaders, Pretenders, and Godseekers
Three Spell Lores: Lore of Slaanesh, Forbidden Sorceries of Slaanesh, and the Lore of Pain and Pleasure
Path to Glory campaigns – rules for creating a Hedonites of Slaanesh warband for Path to Glory, including Champion Rewards Table, and Followers Rewards Tables
Four Warscroll Battalions that reward you for fielding thematic combinations of models
18 unit warscrolls, 3 endless spell warscrolls and a warscroll for the Fane of Slaanesh, printed here for your convenience
Pitched Battle Profiles for all units, endless spells, and the Fane of Slaanesh featured in this battletome, including minimum/maximum unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age Of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Maggotkin of Nurgle
boardgame.description:
Nurgle is the Chaos God of plagues, whose power waxes strong when disease and despair ravage the Mortal Realms. Though he is a source of fear and revulsion to his enemies, Nurgle is a perversely paternal god, generous with his foul gifts and proud of his worshippers’ every disgusting achievement. His armies, both mortal and daemon, bulge with virulent boons. The twisted and disfigured, the spiteful and forsaken, the hopelessly insane – these Maggotkin spread the joyous filth and bountiful contagions, hoping to turn the whole of the Mortal Realms into a single garden of beautiful putrescence.

In the 104-page hardback Battletome: Maggotkin of Nurgle, you’ll find:

- Grandfather Nurgle: disturbingly cheerful background information on the most plaguesome of Chaos Gods, delving into his fraught relationship with the other gods, his hideous and bloated physical form and his obsession with the lush, inexhaustible cornucopia of Ghyran;
- The Garden of Nurgle: a horribly detailed description of Nurgle’s domain within the Realm of Chaos;
- Details of the Daemons of Nurgle, from Plaguebearers to Great Unclean Ones, describing their foul methods of war, along with descriptions of Nurgle’s vast armies of mortal followers;
- Armies of the Plague God: the organisation and structure of Nurgle’s armies – the Plague Legions and the Rotbringer Contagiums;
- Warbands of the Plague God: descriptions, sigils and colour schemes for 6 specific Nurgle warbands – The Munificent Wanderers, The Befouling Host, The Droning Guard, The Blessed Sons, The Drowned Men and the Filthbringers;
- Annals of Entropy: a timeline of significant battles and events in the history of Nurgle’s forces;
- Detailed background on the forces available to Nurgle, including mortals and daemons;
- A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example Maggotkin army.

Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Maggotkin army ready for the gaming table are here:

- 24 Warscrolls, covering mortal and daemon followers alike;
- Allegiance Abilities representing the foul gifts that Nurgle’s patronage bestows – including the Cycle of Corruption, a table of filthy boons that will prove advantageous; the Garden of Nurgle, featuring rules for Feculent Gnarlmaws; and rules for summoning daemons using accrued Contagion Points;
- Command Traits for Rotbringers, daemon and mortal followers – 6 each;
- Artefacts of Power for Rotbringers, daemon and mortal followers – 6 each;
- The Lores of Nurgle: spells for daemon and mortal Nurgle wizards, including Foul Regenesis, a spell known by all Nurgle wizards; Lore of Malignance – 3 spells available to any Rotbringer wizard; Lore of Virulence – 3 spells available to any Nurgle daemon Wizard; and Lore of Foulness – 3 spells available to any Nurgle mortal wizard;
- Rules for creating a Nurgle warband to use in a Path to Glory campaign, including Followers Rewards Table, Champion Rewards Table and Patronage of Nurgle Tables (featuring lesser, greater and exalted rewards);
- A specific Battleplan – Seeds of Corruption – for use with Maggotkin armies;
- 8 Warscroll Battalions conferring advantages for fielding certain combinations of models;
- Pitched Battle Profiles for all units featured in this Battletome, including unit sizes, points values and battlefield roles.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition) Core Rules

boardgame.name: La Guerre de 1870: La chute de Napoléon III (juillet-août 1870)
boardgame.description:
Early August 1870. The Prussian Chancellor Bismarck has accomplished a diplomatic master stroke thanks to the Ems Dispatch: France has just declared war on Prussia. Prussia was able to gather all of the German states around it while Napoleon IIIs empire remains alone with no nation willing to support the perceived aggressor.

In Paris, the belligerent frenzy has brought the population to the boiling point and they already see themselves at Berlin. France claims to have the better army. Didn’t the war minister Marshal Leboeuf declare his unequivocal assurance to Adolphe Thiers, himself lacking in confidence as to the country’s preparation : « We are prepared and extremely prepared. If the war were to last two years, our soldiers would not lack for a single gaiter button”.

The mobilisation is launched and the troops rush toward their concentration point on the border. But apathy meets with incompetence : plans that have been prepared for a long time are modified several times, the mess in the stations is indescribable. In addition, this is an incomplete army led by superior officers who do not know their troops well and who position themselves to lead an offensive without a plan but an offensive that has been rendered obligatory by popular demand.

On the other side, the Prussian state has learned from the experience of its two previous campaigns: the Second Schleswig War against Denmark in 1864 and especially the Seven Weeks War against Austria in 1866. The mobilisation then the concentration proceed like clockwork. The long-established plans and orders are followed to the letter. The invasion may begin as planned.


In "La Guerre de 1870", an evolution of The Marshals series for the campaigns of the 2nd Empire, will you, as Napoléon III, finally become your uncle’s worthy military heir by saving your country from the Prussian enemy? As von Moltke, will you be able to wisely manoeuvre your divisions to drive the French to a decisive battle to occur where and when you decide ?

—description from the publisher

This wargame can be linked with "Sedan 1870" to play the full Campaign of the Imperial War since the beginning of the war until the final decisive battle of Sedan.
(https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/306065/sedan-1870)


Complexity : 7/10
Solo playability : 6/10
One turn = 1 day
One counter = 1 division (and 1 SP = 2000 men, 1000 cavaliers or 2 batteries)
Scale : 10 km between 2 zones

boardgame.name: Influentia
boardgame.description:
The Year 2077. Four families of identical lineage; a country, Italy, the setting to this scene, and an ancient conflict perpetuated in time. Northern Italy is now a battlefield where megacorporations fight to control the main sources of power.

Perhaps you can influence the netrunners of Bologna or control the cyber traffic of implants through the technosurgeons of Pisa. It won’t be easy, but you have to beat rival families to reach the top. Your future is at stake.

Influentia is a card game based on classic trick-taking card games. In each trick, players play one of their Resource Cards. The winner of the trick may choose one of the City Cards from among those available or the Resource Card that was just played by another player. The other players keep the cards they played as these will allow them to activate a variety of effects once they have two identical Symbols. After three rounds, the player who has won the most victory points wins the game.


Año 2077. Cuatro familias de idéntico linaje; un país, Italia, lugar de nuestra escena, y un antiguo conflicto perpetuado en el tiempo. El norte de Italia es ahora mismo un campo de batalla donde las megacorporaciones intentan controlar las principales fuentes de poder.

Quizás puedas influir con tus créditos sobre los netrunners de Bologna o controlar el tráfico de implantes cibernéticos mediante los tecnomédicos de Pisa. No será fácil, pero debes hacerlo mejor que el resto de familias rivales para llegar a lo más alto. Vuestro futuro está en juego.

Influentia es un juego de cartas basado en los juegos clásicos de bazas. En cada baza, los jugadores jugarán una de sus cartas de Recurso. El ganador de la baza podrá elegir una de las cartas de Ciudad de entre las disponibles o la carta de Recurso que acaba de jugar otro jugador. Los demás jugadores conservarán sus cartas jugadas ya que estas les permitirán activar diversos efectos en cuanto reúnan dos símbolos idénticos. Tras 3 rondas, ganará aquel jugador que haya conseguido más puntos de victoria.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Farts & Fairies
boardgame.description:
Farts & Fairies is a high octane, totally out of control fart battle for 2-6 players.

To win, you must outfart your friends by launching and dodging fart attacks to become the 'Survivor of the Fartest'.

This outrageously epic card game features the Queen of Farts, Farta Christmas, Tea Farties and Fartomic Bombs.

Butt here's the best bit... For every game sold, they donate one to a child in hospital. Because farts are funny and laughter is the best medicine.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800
boardgame.description:
In Anno 1800, a board game based on the popular PC game from Ubisoft, you continuously build up your own industry to develop your home island.

Ship fleets allow for lively trade and the development of new islands in the Old and New World. You have to fulfill the wishes of your own population. While the inhabitants are initially satisfied with bread and clothing, they soon demand valuable luxury goods. You must plan production chains sensibly and keep an eye on the specialization of your population. The goal: A wise distribution of farmers, workers, craftsmen, engineers, and investors — but the competition never sleeps and can snatch the new achievements from under your nose at any time! Who can create the most prosperous island?

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Rise of the Drow Collector's Edition (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tonight, a ceremony of light is taking place on the surface.
Meanwhile, a world away in the city of spiders, a drow matron solidifies a pact with soul-consuming entities who require great sacrifices in trade for unimaginable power. Drow eyes turn to the surface.

This book contains a mega-adventure and setting, taking characters across the surface and into the depths of the world. Adventurers will meet unique denizens, battle horrors of the Underworld, explore epic locations, and fight to stop the rise of the drow.

boardgame.name: Open seas
boardgame.description:
Open Seas is a pen and paper solo sandbox game. Controlling a captain and a first mate, navigate an endless archipelago filled with dangerous creatures, hidden treasures, and bustling cities. How you manage to survive dangers on land and at sea while paying expenses and maintaining morale will be up to you: explore, trade, fish, hunt for treasure, complete quests, upgrade your ship, build a base, and gain new abilities as your characters level up. But time is not on your side: many quests need to be completed quickly, treasure hunts may yield nothing if you linger, businesses may close down, and an ever-growing evil presence makes all challenges more difficult with each passing day.

To play the game, you need to print or reproduce a Characters sheet, a Locations sheet, and a Navigation sheet found at the end of the rule book (you may need additional copies of the last two). You also need a 10-sided die or two (to roll a d100), a pen, a pencil, and an eraser.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Summit of Kings: Battle for the Supreme Jalen
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Once a year there is a special, one of a kind tournament held on the beautiful coast of The Isle. The Summit of Kings. A yearly battle where the top Jalens from around the world are invited to find out who is the best in straight oratorial combat. The only way to get into the Summit is through a special invite.

User info:

A quickstart for the Swordsfall RPG.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Pionnenparade
Monopoly: Pions en folie
boardgame.description:
This is the classic Monopoly Belgium game, but with 16 pawns in one set! The game contains 8 gold pawns. Buy and trade assets, rent and let your opponents go bankrupt. In addition to the 8 classic pawns, this Monopoly Pawn Parade contains 8 extra golden pawns. Buy and trade assets, rent and let your opponents go bankrupt.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dit is het klassieke Monopoly België spel, maar dan met 16 pionnen in één set! Het spel bevat 8 gouden pionnen. Koop en verhandel bezittingen, in huur en laat je tegenstanders failliet gaan. Deze Monopoly Pionnenparade bevat naast de 8 klassieke pionnen nog 8 extra gouden pionnen. Koop en verhandel bezittingen, in huur en laat je tegenstanders failliet gaan.

—description from the publisher
